intro: Anneslea amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian anneslea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or in the undergrowth of dense forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
